name: Math Homework
content:
You've been assigned a number of math problems by your teacher. However, they're pretty hard and you don't want to do them! Instead, you create a program to solve the problems for you. There are a few new operations in your homework:
  • < means to take the first number, divide it by two, and multiply it by three times the second number. For example, 5<6 = 2.5*18 = 45.
  • > means to take the first number, add 6, and divide it by the second number. For example, 5>6 = 11/6.
  • ~ means to take the square of the first number, and add the second number. For example, 5~6 = 25+6 = 31.
For each operation, after computing the result, round down to the nearest integer (so 11/6 would become 1). All of these operations have the same precedence (order of operations).
input: The first line of input will consist of one integer, t, the number of problems (1 ≤ t ≤ 100). Each following line will contain a math problem to solve. For 3 points, there is only one operation per problem, no brackets, and all numbers are less than 10. For another 3 points, there are no brackets. It is guaranteed that there is a solution for all problems and each solution ≤ 10^9.
output: For each problem, solve and output the result.
